definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
scattered/loose/to come loose/to fall apart/leisurely/powdered medicine
to scatter/to break up (a meeting etc)/to disperse/to disseminate/to dispel/(coll.) to sack

pinyin: guang1 xian1 fen1 san4 shi4 zi1 liao4 jie4 mian4

sentences.english: Bitcoin has a completely distributed architecture, without any single trusted entity.
sentences.chinese: 比特幣的結構是完全分散式的，沒有任何可信實體。

sentences.english: One's going to be a power plant, and one is a distributed resource.
sentences.chinese: 前者將成爲發電廠，後者是一種分散式資源。

sentences.english: Another principle is support for decentralized communication.
sentences.chinese: 另一個原則是支持分散式通信。

sentences.english: Replication can be used in conjunction with either centralized or decentralized approaches.
sentences.chinese: 複製可以與集中式或分散式方法共同使用。

definition: to access (a network)/to insert (a plug) into (a socket)
